Title:
The mitochondrial and chloroplast genomes of the haptophyte
Chrysochromulina tobin contain unique repeat structures and gene
profiles
Keywords:
haptophytes, chloroplast genome, mitochondrial genome,
repeat structure, repeat function
Abstract:
Background: Haptophytes are widely and abundantly
distributed in both marine and freshwater ecosystems. Few genomic
analyses of representatives in this taxon have been reported, despite
their early evolutionary divergence from other algal species and their
prominent role in global carbon fixation.
